title: Shoe Size Outlier
question_text:
The dotplot below shows the shoe sizes for a group of $31\text{ nine-year-old girls}$.
Which of the following is the MOST plausible conclusion that can be made from the dotplot?

choices.text:
The shoe size of
10
should be thrown out.

Most of the girls have shoe sizes greater than
5
.

One of the girls' shoe sizes was accidentally recorded as a
10
instead of a
1
.

Most of the girls have a shoe size of
2
or less.
None of the above statements is plausible.

solution:
The dotplot shows a clear outlier at size
10
. When an outlier is observed, we cannot immediately dismiss it. Instead, we should consider what might have made it happen. In some cases, a subject doesn't follow directions or answers incorrectly.

In other cases, there was a typo in data entry. And sometimes, the value really did happen and this observation needs to be examined more carefully.

In this case, the most likely explanation is that the shoe size of
10
really was a shoe size of
1
like three of the other girls in the group.
